title: Deilie Jock
author: Campbell, C. M.
snippet: As sure as death, it's the truth I'm tellin' ye. I was unloadin' a ship at Leith Docks, and a heavy case slippet aff the crane and plunked fair on my thigh." Here the model stroked the injured limb by way of clinical demonstration.

title: White House at Inch Gow, etc. [A tale.]
author: Pitt, Sarah.
snippet: Captain Sage was very little in evidence in those days. He seemed to spend his time chiefly in Leith Docks: as he said, getting things ship-shape for his next absence. He came up in the evenings, and talked to Mrs. Craven or was talked to by her, while Eleanor
